result.execSummary:
The defendant Marrio L Harding was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/DNA Surcharge to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing 12/01/2016 or penalty of 10 days Huber for non-payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marrio L Harding

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Marrio L Harding in court with attorney Joseph James Dorlack.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended information filed.  Formal reading waived.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty fo count #1.  Counts 2,3, and 4 are dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Dorlack makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1. 

FINE:  $820.00 

DNA Surcharge: $200.00 

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Fine/ DNA to be paid at the rate of $100.00 a month commencing 12/1/2016.  Failure to pay will result in 10 days huber.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Marrio L Harding in court.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant needs more time to obtain counsel.
